IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: THE EVJUE FOUNDATION, INC. IS A PUBLIC CHARITY ORGANIZED TO MAKE CONTRIBUTIONS TO RELIGIOUS, CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS.
IRS990.MissionDescription: THE EVJUE FOUNDATION IS A PUBLIC CHARITY ORGANIZED UNDER CHAPTER 181 OF THE WISCONSIN STATUTES TO MAKE CONTRIBUTIONS TO RELIGIOUS, CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS IN SUPPORT OF ACTIVITIES WHICH BENEFIT OR CARRY OUT THE PURPOSES OF THE MADISON COMMUNITY FOUNDATION AND THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN FOUNDATION. THE FOUNDATION IS THE CHARITABLE ARM OF THE CAPITAL TIMES COMPANY.
IRS990.Description: CONTRIBUTIONS TO RELIGIOUS, CHARITABLE, EDUCATIONAL, CIVIC AND CULTURAL ORGANIZATIONS.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: FORM 990 SCHEDULE I PART I LINE 2
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.ReturnReference: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS IN THE UNITED STATES
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: THE ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING GRANTS ARE REQUIRED TO RETURN A FORM INDICATING HOW THE GRANT FUNDS WERE USED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A LINE 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOLLOWING DIRECTORS LISTED IN PART VII, SECTION A HAVE A FAMILY RELATIONSHIP: JOHN H. LUSSIER, JAMES D. LUSSIER, LAURA J. LUSSIER-LEE

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A LINE 7A
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: MEMBERS WHO MAY ELECT ONE OR MORE MEMBERS OF THE GOVERNING BODY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN FOUNDATION AND THE MADISON COMMUNITY FOUNDATION MAY EACH ELECT FOUR MEMBERS TO THE GOVERNING BODY.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B LINE 11A
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: PROCESS ORGANIZATION USES TO REVIEW FORM 990
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE SECRETARY/TREASURER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION B LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: MONITORING AND ENFORCING COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO ALL EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS OF THE ORGANIZATION. EACH EMPLOYEE AND BOARD MEMBER IS REQUIRED TO COMPLETE AN ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORM. EMPLOYEES AND BOARD MEMBERS MUST INDICATE ANY CONFLICTS OF INTEREST THAT EXIST WITH ORGANIZATIONS RECEIVING, OR POTENTIALLY RECEIVING, GRANTS FROM THE FOUNDATION. CONFLICTS OF INTEREST ARE REVIEWED ON A GRANT BY GRANT BASIS. WHEN A CONFLICT OF INTEREST IS DETERMINED TO EXIST, THE BOARD MEMBER WITH THE CONFLICT IS REQUIRED TO ABSTAIN FROM VOTING ON ANY POTENTIAL TRANSACTIONS WITH THE CONFLICTING ORGANIZATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION C LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NO DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990 PART VI SECTION A LINE 8B
GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: DOCUMENTATION OF MINUTES OF EACH COMMITTEE
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THERE ARE NO SEPARATE COMMITTEES APPOINTED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
